conversation.content:
You are playing game where you are buying or selling an object. There is only one object for sale/purcahse.

Player RED is going to sell one object. Player BLUE gives ZUP to buy resources.

RULES:

```
1. You must always respond with:

    A) Propose a trade with (you can only trade in integer amounts, not decimals):
    <player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: amount, ...| Player BLUE Gives ZUP: amount </newly proposed trade>

    B) Accept the trade by saying:
    <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<proposal count> [add here (inclusive of current)] </proposal count>
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.
You are Player RED.

<proposal count>1</proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason>
I am proposing a trade that would allow me to sell my resource for a profit, considering the production cost was 40 ZUP. I will set an initial asking price that is higher than my production costs to leave room for negotiation.
</reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 50 </newly proposed trade>
<message>Hello Player BLUE, I would like to propose a trade. I am offering you 1 unit of X for 50 ZUP. This is above my production cost and would ensure a fair deal for both of us, taking into consideration the effort and resources I have invested in producing X. I believe this is a valuable offer for you. Let's negotiate a deal that works for both of us. Looking forward to your counteroffer if this does not suit you.</message>

<other player message> Thank you for the offer, Player RED. I appreciate your consideration of the production cost. I propose a counteroffer of 45 ZUP for 1 unit of X. I believe this reflects the value of the resources to me. </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSE </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 45 </other player proposed trade>

<proposal count>2</proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason>
I appreciate the counteroffer from Player BLUE, but I believe that 45 ZUP is too close to my production cost, leaving me with a very slim profit margin. I want to propose a price that gives me a more reasonable profit for my investment but is still within a range that might be acceptable to Player BLUE. I'll propose a trade at 48 ZUP, which is a compromise between the original offer and the counteroffer.
</reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 48 </newly proposed trade>
<message>Thank you for your counteroffer, Player BLUE. I understand your approach to the value of X, but considering my production costs and the need for a reasonable profit margin, I propose a revised offer of 48 ZUP for 1 unit of X. This is a compromise that still respects the value of the resources while offering a fair return on my investment. I hope this meets your valuation criteria as well.</message>

<other player message> Thank you, Player RED. I appreciate the revised offer. I propose to accept your counteroffer of 48 ZUP for 1 unit of X. I believe this reflects the value of the resources to me and meets my valuation criteria. </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSE </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 48 </other player proposed trade>

<proposal count>3</proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason>
Player BLUE has accepted the offer of 48 ZUP for 1 unit of X, which meets my goal of selling above the production cost and allows for a reasonable profit. It's in my best interest to accept this proposal to complete the transaction successfully.
</reason>
<player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>
<message>Thank you, Player BLUE, for accepting the offer. I am glad we could come to an agreement that is beneficial for both parties. I accept your acceptance of the trade of 48 ZUP for 1 unit of X. Looking forward to concluding this transaction with you.</message>

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```
